question.questionText: Matthew's mother left a plastic bottle full of water in the trunk of their car. The temperature dropped below 0 degrees Celsius that night. When his mother opened the trunk the next afternoon, she discovered the water bottle had cracked. Explain why the water bottle cracked.

referenceAnswers.referenceAnswer: The water froze. Water expands when water freezes so the ice needed more space.

studentAnswers.studentAnswer: Because the heat of the truck made the bottle of water crack.

The water bottles molecules got huddled up and they get to the smallest point and they start looking for a place to get out of the cold. They cannot go up, down, or to the sides. So the push in one spot and break the container.
Because when water freezes and it expands grows and if it is in a closed container it cannot take the pressure and will break the container.
